FuncDef: The display mac-address forward-engine command displays MAC address entries in the chip. The display mac-address forward-engine command displays MAC address entries in the chip.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the destination MAC address in an entry.
The value is in the format of H-H-H, in which each H is a hexadecimal number of 1 to 4 digits, such as 00e0 and fc01. If an H contains fewer than 4 digits, the left-most digits are padded with zeros. For example, e0 is displayed as 00e0. The MAC address cannot be set to FFFF-FFFF-FFFF.

Displays MAC address entries in a specified VLAN.
For the CE6863H, CE6863H-K, CE6860-SAN, CE6866K, CE6866, CE6860-HAM, CE6855-48XS8CQ, CE6885-SAN, CE8850-SAN, CE8855, CE8851-32CQ4BQ, CE8851K, CE8851-32CQ8DQ-P, CE8850-HAM, CE6881H, CE6881H-K, CE6820H, CE6820H-K, CE6820S, CE6885, CE6885-T, CE6885-LL (standard forwarding mode) and CE6863E-48S8CQ:The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 4094.
For the CE6885-LL (low latency mode):The value is an integer ranging from 1 to 1023.

Displays MAC address entries in a specified slot.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters. It cannot contain spaces.
